# Bourke Award

The Bourke Award of the Royal Society of Chemistry is an annual prize open to academics from outside the UK. Originally established by the Faraday Society and known as the Bourke Lectures, the award of Â£2000 enables experts in physical chemistry or chemical physics to present their work in the UK. The winner also receives a commemorative medal.
In 2020 the Bourke Award was merged with the Liversidge Award to create the Bourke-Liversidge Award.
